get.description: Returns a list of your organization's <<glossary:account>>(s).

post.description: Creates a new Account for your organization.

reference-id.description: Reference ID on Account, refers to an entity in your user model

data.description: Selfie photo data, must be an image. Can also be provided as an uploaded file such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object.

tags.description: A list of tag names that are associated to an Account.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes personally identifiable information (PII) for an Account and all associated Inquiries, Verifications and Reports. This action cannot be undone. 

This endpoint can be used to comply with privacy regulations such as GDPR / CCPA or to enforce data privacy.

Note: An account is still updatable after redaction. If you want to delete data continuously, please reach out to us to help you setup a retention policy.

get.description: Retrieve the details of an Account that has previously been created.

reference-id.description: Reference ID on Account, refers to an entity in your user model

data.description: Selfie photo data, must be an image. Can also be provided as an uploaded file such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object.

tags.description: A list of tag names that are associated to an Account.

post.description: Add a new tag to an Account

Consolidates several source Accounts' information into one target Account. Any Inquiry, Verification, Report and Document associated with the source Account will be transferred over to the destination Account. However, the Account's attributes will not be transferred. After consolidation, you can update the destination Account's attributes using the Account update endpoint.

This endpoint can be used to clean up duplicate Accounts.

Note: A source account can only be consolidated once. Afterwards, the source account will be archived.

source-account-ids.description: A list of Account IDs that need to be consolidated into the destination Account.

post.description: Removes an existing tag from an Account
Set all tags on an Account. Note that this removes any tags that are not provided.

expires-in-seconds.description: Number of seconds from now to expire the key (max of 30 days)

get.description:
Returns a list of your organization's cases.
Note that this endpoint aggregates cases across all <<glossary:case template>>(s). See [Pagination](https://docs.withpersona.com/reference/pagination) for more details about handling the response.

case-template-id.description: Filter cases by case template ID

post.description: Create a new case in your organization.

attributes.description: Properties can include Case Template ID, creator email address, and fields configured on your Case Template.

case-template-id.description: ID of the case template for this case

creator-email-address.description: Email of the user creating this case in the organization

object-ids.description: Array of Persona object IDs that should be related to this case

sla-expires-in-seconds.description: Number of seconds from now when SLA expires (max of 90 days).

delete.description: Permanently redact a <<glossary:case>> and its fields. Case objects must be redacted individually. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a <<glossary:case>> that has previously been created.

patch.description: Updates the fields and add attachments on a <<glossary:case>> that has been previously created.

parameters.description: ID of the case to update
parameters.name: case-id

attachments.description: List of PDF and image files to add to this case.

fields.description: Note: field names and data types used here will depend on the configurations for your Case Template.

sla-expires-in-seconds.description: Number of seconds from now when SLA expires (max of 90 days). Set to null to clear SLA.

post.description: Add Persona objects (such as inquiries, accounts, or reports) to a <<glossary:case>>

parameters.description: ID of the case to update
parameters.name: case-id

object-ids.description: Array of Persona object IDs to attach to this case

post.description: Assign a <<glossary:case>> to a Persona user.

parameters.description: ID of the case to update
parameters.name: case-id

user-email-address.description: Email address of the Persona user to whom to assign this case

post.description: Set the status of the Case.

parameters.description: ID of the case to update status
parameters.name: case-id

post.description: Add a new tag to a <<glossary:case>>

parameters.description: ID of the case to update.
parameters.name: case-id

tag-name.description: Name of the tag to add to the Case.

post.description: Remove an existing tag from a <<glossary:case>>

parameters.description: ID of the case to update.
parameters.name: case-id

tag-name.description: Name of the tag to remove from the Case.

post.description: Set all tags on a <<glossary:case>>. Note this removes any tags that are not provided.

parameters.description: ID of the case to update.
parameters.name: case-id

files.description: Files to upload for this document. Files may be images or PDFs.

patch.description: Updates an existing generic document. Can only update `initiated` documents.

Create a new government ID document

data.description: Government ID photo data, must be images. Can provide more than one image and we will pick the best for processing. Can also be provided as uploaded file(s) such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object(s). Images must be between 10KB and 15MB.

country-code.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the IDs issuing country.

data.description: Government ID photo data, must be images. Can provide more than one image and we will pick the best for processing. Can also be provided as uploaded file(s) such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object(s). Images must be between 10KB and 15MB.

patch.description: Updates an existing government ID document. Can only update `initiated` documents.

data.description: Government ID photo data, must be images. Can provide more than one image and we will pick the best for processing. Can also be provided as uploaded file(s) such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object(s). Images must be between 10KB and 15MB.

Government ID photo data, must be images. Can provide more than one image and we will pick the best for processing. Can also be provided as uploaded file(s) such as with multipart/form-data requests instead of this object(s). Images must be between 10KB and 15MB.

post.description: Submit a government ID document for processing. Can only submit `initiated` documents with photos of the ID attached.

Returns a list of your organization's events.

name.description: Comma separated list of event names

object-id.description: Comma separated list of object ids

id.description: Comma separated list of event ids

You can retrieve an importer by its ID.

parameters.name: importer-id

post.description:
Importing accounts allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new Account.

The columns we allow are 
* reference_id
* name_first
* name_middle
* name_last
* birthdate
* social_security_number
* tags

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* value
* match_type (either 'email_address' or 'domain')

A match_type of 'email_address' will need to match the entire email address of an individual, while a match_type of 'domain' will match on the email address domain of an individual (i.e. all email addresses with domain 'gmail.com').
Importing list items allows you to upload image files with each file being a new List Item. We recommend uploading max 50 images (with average image size of 500KB) at a time.

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* latitude
* longitude
* radius_meters

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* id_number
* id_class

Common values for id_class include 'pp' for passport and 'dl' for driver license. Please contact us or reach out to support@withpersona.com if you need help getting id_class values!

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* value

Both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported.

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* name_first
* name_last

Importing list items allows you to upload a CSV file with each row being a new List Item.

The columns we allow are 
* value

get.description:
Returns a list of your organization's inquiries.

Note that this endpoint aggregates inquiries across all <<glossary:template>>(s). See [Pagination](https://docs.withpersona.com/reference/pagination) for more details about handling the response.

note.description: Filter inquiries by note. Must be the only filter.
examples: A note saved on an inquiry

template-id.description: Filter inquiries by template ID (use this field if your template ID starts with `tmpl_`)

inquiry-template-id.description: Filter inquiries by inquiry template ID (use this field if your template ID starts with `itmpl_`)

created-at-start.description: Filter inquiries by creation date, equal to or later than

created-at-end.description: Filter inquiries by creation date, earlier than or equal to

prev.description: URL pointing to the previous page of data, or null if on the first page.

next.description: URL pointing to the next page of data, or null if on the last page.

post.description:
Create a new inquiry with optional pre-filled attributes. 

See [Sessions](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/inquiry-sessions) for how to continue the inquiry in [Embedded Flow](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/embedded-flow) or [Hosted Flow](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/hosted-flow).

template-id.description: Template ID for flow requirements (use this field if your template ID starts with `tmpl_`). *You must pass in either template-id OR inquiry-template-id OR inquiry-template-version-id*

inquiry-template-id.description: Template ID for flow requirements (use this field if your template ID starts with `itmpl_`). *You must pass in either template-id OR inquiry-template-id OR inquiry-template-version-id*

inquiry-template-version-id.description: Template Version ID for flow requirements (begins with `itmplv_`). *You must pass in either template-id OR inquiry-template-id OR inquiry-template-version-id*

reference-id.description: Reference ID to refer to an entity in your user model. This field is deprecated in favor of `meta.auto-create-account-reference-id`.

account-id.description: Account ID to associate with this inquiry

creator-email-address.description: Email of the user creating this inquiry in the organization

theme-id.description: Theme ID for styling. Only available for Legacy 2.0 Inquiries.

theme-set-id.description: BETA FEATURE -- Theme Set ID for styling. Only available for Dynamic Flow Inquiries.

redirect-uri.description: If using the Hosted flow, redirect to this URL after completion

note.description: Unstructured field for your custom use

auto-create-account.description: If true, automatically create an Account for the user if one does not exist. Default is true.

auto-create-account-type-id.description:
If `auto-create-account` is true, the type ID to use for the Account. If not provided, the default type ID for the organization will be used.
If `auto-create-account-reference-id` is present and corresponds to an existing Account, `auto-create-account-type-id` will be ignored.
Will error if passed when `auto-create-account` is false.

auto-create-account-reference-id.description:
If `auto-create-account` is true, this Inquiry will be attached to the Account with this reference ID, or a new Account will be created with this reference ID if one does not exist.
Will error if passed when `auto-create-account` is false. To associate new Inquiries with existing Accounts while avoiding creation of new Accounts, pass `account-id` instead.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes personally identifiable information (PII) for an Inquiry and all associated Verifications and Reports. This action cannot be undone. 

This endpoint can be used to comply with privacy regulations such as GDPR / CCPA or to enforce data privacy.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of an inquiry that has previously been created.

In the [Embedded Flow](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/embedded-flow), the `inquiry-id` is the first parameter of the onStart callback. In the [Hosted Flow](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/hosted-flow), the `inquiry-id` is a query parameter in the onComplete callback.

Template information will be found in `data.relationships.inquiry-template` if the inquiry is a Dynamic Flow inquiry, and in `data.relationships.template` if the inquiry is a Legacy 2.0 inquiry. For more information, see [Dynamic Flow vs. Legacy Templates](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/inquiry-templates#dynamic-flow-vs-legacy-templates).

note.description: Unstructured field for your custom use

post.description: Add a new tag to the Inquiry

Approves an <<glossary:inquiry>>.

Note that this action will trigger any associated workflows and webhooks.

Declines an <<glossary:inquiry>>.

Note that this action will trigger any associated workflows and webhooks.

Expires an inquiry and all sessions on the inquiry. Cancels any pending verifications on the inquiry.

The inquiry can still be resumed after expiry.
Creates a new inquiry session and returns `meta.one-time-link`.

expires-in-seconds.description: Number of seconds from now to expire the key (must be greater than 0). If not provided, the one-time link expiration setting from the inquiry template version will apply. Default expiry is 24 hours.

get.description: Prints an inquiry as PDF.

post.description: Remove an existing tag from an Inquiry

Creates a new inquiry session and returns `meta.session-token`. If the inquiry's status is `expired`, changes the status to `pending`. The `session-token` must be included when loading the inquiry flow if the inquiry's status is `pending`. For more information, see [Resuming Inquiries](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/inquiries-resuming-inquiries).
Set all tags on an Inquiry. Note that this removes any tags that are not provided.
Perform a series of simulated actions on a Sandbox inquiry.

type.description: The type of simulate action. See [valid actions](https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/simulate-inquiry-actions).

inquiry-id.description: Filter inquiry sessions by inquiry ID

post.description: Creates a new Inquiry Session.

get.description: List all reports with pagination and filtering.

post.description: Create various types of Reports with appropriate body params.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes personally identifiable information (PII) for a Report.

This endpoint can be used to comply with privacy regulations such as GDPR / CCPA or to enforce data privacy.

Note that this will only delete the report -- it does not delete associated accounts, inquiries, or verifications.

get.description: Retrieve the details of a Report.

post.description: Add a new tag to the Report
Dismiss active matches for supported report types

dismiss-type.description: required in case of Adverse Media and Business Adverse Media. "entity" - refers to one of several individuals or businesses found by the report. "media" - refers to specific article about that "entity"

entity-id.description: required in case of Adverse Media and Business Adverse Media. refers to id of the "entity" or the "media".

post.description: Pause continuous monitoring on a report. Requires additional permissions

get.description: Prints a report in PDF format.

post.description: Remove an existing tag from a Report

Re-run a continuously monitored report immediately, outside of its existing recurrence schedule.
Set all tags on a Report. Note that this removes any tags that are not provided.

includeQueryParameter.description: A comma-separated list of relationship paths. This can be used to customize which related resources will be fully serialized in the `included` key in the response. An empty value indicates that no related resources should be returned. If not provided, the default set of included relationships will be returned (for some APIs this may be none).

name.example: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Member Countries Representation

sources.description: A map of the sources that matched by entity

email-address.description: The input email address of the search

email-reputation.description: The reputation of the email provided

email-reference-count.description: The number of sources used to determine the reputation (Deprecated)

email-domain-reputation.description: The reputation of the email domain provided (Deprecated)

email-first-seen-days.description: How many days it has ben since the email was first seen in attack (Deprecated)

email-last-seen-days.description: How many days it has been since the email was last seen (Deprecated)

email-estimated-age-days.description: The estimated age of the email in days

email-domain-age-days.description: The estimated age of the domain in days

email-credentials-leaked.description: Whether the email has ever been detected to have been leaked (Deprecated)

email-credentials-leaked-recent.description: Whether the email has been recently detected as leaked

email-data-breached.description: Whether the email was involved in a data breach (Deprecated)

email-malicious-activity-detected.description: Whether the email has ever been detected for suspected malicious activity (Deprecated)

email-malicious-activity-detected-recent.description: Whether the email has recently been detected for suspected malicious activity

email-is-blocklisted.description: Whether the email appears on blocklists (Deprecated)

email-is-free-provider.description: Whether the email was made with a free provider (Deprecated)

email-is-disposable.description: Whether the email is one that is disposable or temporary

email-is-valid-mx.description: Whether the domain has a valid MX record

email-is-spoofable.description: Whether the email can be spoofed. (E.G. not a strict SPF policy or DMARC not enforced. Deprecated)

email-is-spf-strict.description: Whether there is a sufficiently strict SPF record (Deprecated)

email-is-dmarc-enforced.description: Whether DMARC is configured correctly and enforced (Deprecated)

email-is-suspicious.description: Whether the email is suspicious or risky

email-domain-exists.description: Whether the domain of the email exists

phone-number.description: The input phone number of the search

phone-risk-level.description: Assessment of the phone number's risk (low - high)

phone-risk-sim-swap.description: The risk of a fraudulent SIM swap

ExtractionResponses.description: A list of extractions resulting from processing the uploaded documents corresponding to the document's extraction configuration.

results.description: A list of objects containing the actual value extracted and additional information relevant to the extraction result.

page.description: The page number the extraction result is detected. Page is 1-indexed.

match-level.description: If extraction-type is guided, match-level describes the degree in which the extracted value is similar to the source value. Otherwise the match-level is full.

metadata.description: This is a free-form object containing potentially helpful metadata on the extraction result.

fields.description: JSON key-value pairs of field name to field value.

files.description: The files uploaded to the associated document for processing.
